name: Drahomír Dlabaja
description: Skilled software engineer with a proven ability to lead and collaboratively tackle complex problems, analyze solutions with their trade-offs, and make sure the implementation meets customer needs. Proactive strategic thinker who can get things done.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Working as a technical lead of Chyron Weather™, a product for interactive visualization of weather forecasts for broadcast.
Leading maintenance of a 20-year-old, 10M LOC legacy codebase.
Collaborating in a cross-functional, diverse team of nine software developers.
Mentoring team members and leading technical discussions.
Actively promoting healthy agile development practices. Introduced agility into our processes with measurable positive outcomes.

experience.title: Software Developer
description: Worked on BlueSkyPlan™, a product for dental treatment planning.
As a member of a Geometry Team, I spent most of the time researching, implementing, and optimizing advanced algorithms and data structures for mesh and voxel data.
I dipped my toes into spatial query acceleration, vertical and horizontal parallelism, robust mesh booleans, and more.
As part of a cloud computing initiative, I led the development of a new, platform-independent build architecture for the existing codebase based on modern CMake and Conan.

experience.title: Data Compression Researcher
description: Researched and implemented new, state-of-the-art methodology for compression of 4D light-field image data.
The work was published in Multimedia Tools and Applications journal and presented at the WSCG conference.
The code is publicly available as an open-source library at my GitHub.

education.title: Master's Degree
description: Specialization in Computer Graphics and Interaction.
Thesis on visualization of large volumetric data on CPU, with emphasis on data structures, cache coherency, parallelization, and vectorization.
Developed in cooperation with TESCAN 3DIM, s.r.o.

education.title: Bachelor's Degree
description: Thesis on lossy light field compression.
Received Dean's award for excellent bachelor's thesis.
Presented the research at the Excel@FIT student conference, earned award for quality work and experimental results.
